message.content: This question requires basic knowledge about the thermoregulation in animals. Regardless of whether an animal is hot-blooded or cold-blooded, they all need to be able to regulate their internal body temperature. Option (A) is the correct answer because animals need to be able to store radiant heat to maintain their body temperature. Option (B) is incorrect because washing with water does not relate to thermoregulation. Option (C) is incorrect because while some animals may sunbathe to warm up, it is not a requirement for all animals. Option (D) is incorrect because survival in animals is not solely dependent on fighting.

This question requires some basic knowledge about the survival requirements of animals. Animals, regardless of whether they are hot-blooded or cold-blooded, need to store radiant heat in order to maintain their body temperature and survive. Option (B) is incorrect because washing with water is not a survival requirement for all animals. Option (C) is also incorrect because while some animals may benefit from basking in the sun, it is not a requirement for all animals. Option (D) is incorrect because while some animals may need to fight for survival, it is not a requirement for all animals.

This question requires some basic knowledge about the thermoregulation in animals. Animals regulate their body temperature in order to survive, whether they are hot-blooded (endothermic) or cold-blooded (ectothermic). Option (A) is correct because animals, regardless of their thermoregulation mechanism, need to store radiant heat from the environment. Option (B) and (C) are incorrect because washing with water or bathing in sunshine are not essential for all animals to survive. Option (D) is incorrect because animals do not necessarily need to fight to survive; there are many other survival strategies such as hiding, fleeing, or cooperation.
